The United States officially transfers control of the Panama Canal to Panama.
2000: The dot-com bubble bursts, causing the NASDAQ to crash.
The International Space Station welcomes its first resident crew.
The Tate Modern art gallery opens in London.
The United States presidential election is decided by the Supreme Court.
2001: Collaborative online encyclopedia launches revolutionizing information sharing
Scientists complete mapping of complete human genetic code
Oklahoma City bomber executed by federal lethal injection
Energy corporation files largest bankruptcy in American history
Apple releases portable digital music player holding thousand songs
September 11th terrorist attacks kill 2,977 people launching war on terror
2002: The Euro is introduced as the new currency for twelve European Union countries.
The 2002 Winter Olympics are held in Salt Lake City, Utah.
East Timor is recognized as an independent nation.
The International Criminal Court is established to prosecute international crimes.
Chechen rebels take hundreds of hostages in a Moscow theater.
The FIFA World Cup is co-hosted by South Korea and Japan.
2004: A massive undersea earthquake in the Indian Ocean triggers a devastating tsunami.
NASA's rovers, Spirit and Opportunity, land on Mars to explore the planet.
The social networking site Facebook is launched by Mark Zuckerberg.
The Summer Olympics are held in Athens, Greece.
The European Union undergoes its largest expansion with ten new member countries.
The Boston Red Sox win the World Series for the first time since 1918.
2008: Lehman Brothers bankruptcy triggers financial crisis
Barack Obama elected first African American president
Russia invades Georgia over South Ossetia
Large Hadron Collider begins operation in Switzerland
2010: The Deepwater Horizon oil spill occurs in the Gulf of Mexico.
The Burj Khalifa in Dubai becomes the world's tallest structure.
The FIFA World Cup is held in South Africa.
